channel.title: Xen Timeline
channel.description:
[b]Happy Halloween![/b] We wanted to use the holiday and the sale to announce our rough timeline for Xen. We are currently targeting a summer 2017 release. We will keep you up to date on our progress and we plan to show off some media as we finish developing Xen to give everyone a glimpse at what we are working on.
[b]Why so Long?[/b] We can’t overemphasize how much work it was to get the game on Steam. Most of our effort before launching was put into porting to the retail engine and getting the game to work better than it did in the mod. Since release, the team has been focused on developing Xen. We even planned our updates to have features that would help improve the earthbound levels and Xen (for example CSM).
We want to do Xen the justice it deserves, and have it be the definitive climax to the Half-Life 1 story. To do this we have completely redesigned and expanded the Xen levels to what we think Valve would have done without the limitations of the time.
To help illustrate this, here are some comparison shots of our levels to the original Half-Life levels in Hammer. Not only are our maps substantially bigger than the originals, there are more of them as well.
[u][b]Comparison of HL1 and Black Mesa's first Xen Map[/b][/u] [img]https://i.imgur.com/0jsdWcF.png[/img]
[u][b]Comparison of the first map of Interloper[/b][/u] [img]https://i.imgur.com/zx35JxK.jpg[/img]
As always we want to thank our awesome community for supporting us in Early Access and for being as passionate as us about Half-Life. We have been working really hard on Xen and we hope you are as excited as us to see the full release of Black Mesa. We’ll have more in game media to show off in the near future!
[b]Patch[/b] We also wanted to quickly mention that we have a patch coming for our latest update. This patch fixes:
* The hitching on Linux multiplayer servers and on Linux single player * Russian closed captions * UI fonts being broken for people that do not have Steam set to English * Workshop publish tool not launching * ZECU torso crashing hammer and the game
Thanks!
-The Black Mesa Team

Spotted some new Xen assets coming out of that last update. Looks like structural elements for the scaffolding we’ve been seeing.

item.title: Xen Timeline
item.dc:creator: gladoscake122
item.description:
I did not expect this sudden update of Xen media! It’s beautiful!

Anyone notice the ocean-esque interior? Xen crystals, and that sky… wow! It looks so trippy and alien-y.

Read full topic

item.title: Xen Timeline
item.dc:creator: AsinoEsel
item.description:
Yeah, that’s a detail they took from the expansions I’m sure. Blue Shift Xen was considered the best Xen for many reasons, and this is one of them.

Read full topic

item.title: Xen Timeline
item.dc:creator: Nozoki17
item.description:
I love the additions like the scaffolding and crates, it really pushes the fact that there was scientists working there, unlike in the original where you could only find bodies

Read full topic

item.title: Xen Timeline
item.dc:creator: AsinoEsel
item.description:
Okay, so what do you guys think of the two new screenshots the devs released?
First screenshot and second screenshot.

Personally, I absolutely love the lighting and colors. You can really tell why they were pushing for godrays.
The old Xen looked very bland with its fleshy monochrome colors, Black Mesa Xen looks a lot more colorful and alien to me.
I love the contrast between the light blue sky and the orange Xen crystals that’s going on. And the Xen fauna looks great as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Xen Timeline
item.dc:creator: Ape
item.description:
I was hoping for the release to coincide with the Steam Summer Sale, but the Devs said they would start wetting our appetites before release

… with only a few days left to Steam Sale I’m starting to get sad I check for new content once a week but nothing… sigh

Read full topic

item.title: Xen Timeline
item.dc:creator: AsinoEsel
item.description:
JeffMOD:

I would love to see a L4D/Alien Swarm-style colour parameter on props

Yes, this please. This is something that Valve has pushed extensively in CS:GO as well, even adding a $notint parameter to VMTs that tells the game what parts of a model NOT to tint (given the model consists of multiple materials), as shown in this example.

Read full topic

item.title: Xen Timeline
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
I would love to see a L4D/Alien Swarm-style colour parameter on props - I could see myself getting a lot of use out of that with custom assets, and a lot of the vehicle models added in the STU update are L4D2 models built with that feature in mind. There could potentially be some use in applying that tech to xenian landscapes as well, to boost variation in the organic and rock props without creating whole new skins.

That said, even the new models they’ve already shown off in that one screenshot would make me a happy camper (mapper?) so I’m not going to hold it against them if they don’t implement that parameter.

EDIT: Just happened across the Content Creator Request thread, and it seems I already stated my desire to see it and got a confirmation that it was in the works at the time. It was supposed to come out in Content Update 3, but as is often the case for programming tasks, it must have gotten pushed back due to bugs. That or they forgot to put it in the fgd. Either way, hopeful it will be fixed by Xen’s release.

Read full topic

item.title: Xen Timeline
item.dc:creator: Admiral_Sakai
item.description:
I for one have gotten less and less interested in the actual design of Xen as I’ve become more and more interested in what sort of engine improvements we might be seeing along with it. The new RAD compile parameters discussed way back when are neat, but they’ve also piqued my curiosity about what else may be to come.

Read full topic

item.title: Xen Timeline
item.dc:creator: RedEye
item.description:
Admiral Sakai:
JohnWorfin:

I corrected you spelling for you

Oh the irony.

The Internet, she is a stern mistress.

Crypt:

devs y have u r remaining silent on the issue

Isn’t it obvious. They have taken all the ea money and split it 50 ways. Each developer has bought their own Caribbean Island and stocked it with exotic wildlife. That is the only reasonable answer, either that or they are busy at work on releasing new media because if they are just squashing bugs and finishing the game I am going to be sorely excited.

Read full topic

item.title: Xen Timeline
item.dc:creator: MichaelTannock
item.description:
They might be thinking of ‘Half-Life: Opposing Force’ or ‘Half-Life: Blue Shift’ which both had return trips from Xen to Black Mesa, especially Opposing Force.
Or they might be confusing the first Xen sequence in Anomalous Materials with the Xen chapter.

Read full topic

item.title: Xen Timeline
item.dc:creator: Nozoki17
item.description:
There is no transitions back to Black Mesa once you arrive on Xen, you must think about Blue Shift or Opposing Force

Read full topic

item.title: Xen Timeline
item.dc:creator: wayne_acoba
item.description:
Johnwalter:

I remember in the first Half Life there was only one transition back to the BM
in the Xen chapter. Could we expect more of these transitions?

IIRC there wasn’t actually a transition back to the BMRF once you arrived in Xen. It’s been ages I played it, so I could be wrong, but I watched a playthrough of one of the original Xen that has been ported to BM as an workshop addition, and there weren’t any transtions back. Not saying it would be cool, tho.

In Blue Shift and OppFor however there were several transtions back to the Facility, I think.

Read full topic

item.title: Xen Timeline
item.dc:creator: Kaltsu
item.description:
Kaltsu:
JohnWorfin:
Nonimportantuser:

According to Google it will be summer on Tuesday, June 20th at 11:24 PM Central Time.

According to the outside of my house, summer is in full swing

I took this picture like an hour ago and according to outside of my residence, summer´s cancelled. So, like, what? Us Finns are not entitled to Xen updates like mighty JohnWorfin here? You should get Xen before everybody else just because it´s sunny where you live? C´mon man…

Ok, so the picture didn´t load but we got snow. Lots and lots of snow!

Read full topic

item.title: Xen Timeline
item.dc:creator: Johnwalter
item.description:
Great, now this thread is starting to derail.
Hope everyone is happy with their unnecessary comments
that do not belong here in the first place.

So i’ll ask something on topic so this comment doesn’t derail it further:

I remember in the first Half Life there was only one transition back to the BM
in the Xen chapter. Could we expect more of these transitions?

item.title: Xen Timeline
item.dc:creator: Crawfish
item.description:
CPU:
Crypt:

I’m in Texas, does that mean that the Xen Update could come any day no matter what time of year?

devs y have u r remaining silent on the issue

…I’m confused

JohnWorfin wanted news about Xen because it’s summer “according to the outside of his house”, despite it not technically actually being summer.
By that logic, Crypt, who lives in Texas, should be entitled to Xen news because the consistent weather in Texas is comparable to a temperate climate’s definition of summer.

That came off as slightly condescending, but I just have fun explain stuff in detail.

Read full topic
